jnaplib.py¶

exception jnaplib.JnapException¶

Exception raised by JnapClient

class jnaplib.JnapClient(serviceNames=None, descriptorPlace=None, descriptors=None, **kwargs)¶

A Python implementation for JNAP client. This client fully support the JNAP protocol. JNAP transaction mode is also supported.

Parameters:
  • serviceNames (list) – A service list to be loaded. If not specified, all the service will be loaded
  • descriptorPlace (path) – The folder which holds the JNAP descriptor files(default:jnapdefs)
  • descriptors (string) – A dict of descriptors in JSON format. The key is service name. The parameter serviceNames and descriptorPlace will be ignored if this parameter is specified.

Other keyword arguments are the same as the method configure()

url¶

The JNAP service URL address (default: None) The service URL must be provided before using the JNAP client.

username¶

User name required by the JNAP service (default: None)

password¶

Password required by the JNAP service (default: None)

timeout¶

Maximum time in seconds that allow the JNAP connection to the server to take. (default: 30)

sslcert¶

The pathname of certificate file (*.PEM) for SSL connection. (default: None)

The PEM file must contain the private key. This property is required for bi-direction authentication.

sslkeypwd¶

The passphase of the encrypted private key.(default: None)

This property is not required if the private key is plain text in the certificate.

This option reserved for future. It has not been implemented.

allow_set_illegalvalue¶

Allow illegal value to be set to the parameter of JNAP request. (defualt: False)

The illegal value contains:

  • Wrong data type
  • Value is not in the enumeration
  • Value is out of the range
  • Value None
allow_get_illegalvalue¶

Allow illegal value is in the parameter of the JNAP response. (defualt: False). The illegal value refers to allow_set_illegalvalue

Note: The corrupted JSON document will cause a exception raise even this option is set to True.

suppress_exception¶

When the runtime exception happened. Return the code “_ErrorRuntime” instead of raising runtime exception. (defualt: False)

The exception includes the following situations:

  • Connection issue
  • Malformed JSON response
enable_compress¶

Compress the JNAP request with gzip before send it. This option may reduce the transimission time for the large JNAP request. (default: True)

This option requires the JNAP server support

compress_threshold¶

The JNAP request larget than this value will be compressed. (default: 524288/512K)

Only available when enable_compress is True.

configure(**kwargs)¶

Configure the options of JNAP client.

Parameters:
  • url (string) – Refer to attribute url
  • username (string) – Refer to attribute username
  • password (string) – Refer to attribute password
  • timeout (number) – Refer to attribute timeout
  • sslcert (path) – Refer to attribute sslcert
  • sslkeypwd (string) – Refer to attribute sslkeypwd
  • allow_set_illegalvalue (bool) – Refer to attribute allow_set_illegalvalue
  • allow_get_illegalvalue (bool) – Refer to attribute allow_get_illegalvalue
  • suppress_exception (bool) – Refer to attribute suppress_exception
  • enable_compress (bool) – Refer to attribute enable_compress
  • compress_threshold (bool) – Refer to attribute compress_threshold

Note: Set any parameter to None will cause the parameter reset to default value. All above configurations can be set/get from the instance property with the same name.

getConfig(*args)¶

Return a list that contains the value of the requested configurations. The argument is a name list of configurations. It’s the same as the method configure()

Returns:list of values

Example:

>>> timeout, username = client.getConfig('timeout', 'username')
>>> print(timeout, username)
makeRequest(action, **kwargs)¶

Get the JNAP request payload data (JSON) from Python Style parameters.

Parameters:
  • action (string) – Action name, refer to method call()
  • kwargs – Python Style JNAP Parameters, refer to method call()
Returns:

A tuple of (<action-name>, <request-json>). The action-name is the full name of the action.
Exception:
JnapException will be raised if there is any error

with the parameters
parseResponse(action, jsonResponse)¶

Parse and validate the data returned by JNAP server

Parameters:
  • action (string) – Action name, refer to method call()
  • jsonResponse (string) – The JSON document which is returned by JNAP server
Returns:

a Python object composed of a list/tuple/dict
Exception:

JnapException will be raised if there is any error with the responsed parameters.
rawCall(action, jsonRequest)¶

Call JNAP action with raw JSON data

Parameters:
  • action (string) – Refer to call()
  • jsonRequest (string) – JNAP request data in the form of JSON. It can be composed by makeRequest()
Returns:

JNAP response represents as a JSON string. It can be convert to Python object with function parseResponse()
Exception:

Any error will cause the JnapException raised
call(action, **kwargs)¶

Call JNAP action with Python Style JNAP Parameters

Parameters:
  • action (string) –

    the name of the action, it has 3 forms:

    • action-name
    • <service-name>.action-name
    • <namespace>.action-name
  • kwargs –

    Python Style JNAP Parameters:

    JNAP JSON Python Description
    bool true/false bool Boolean
    int number int 32-bit signed integer
    string string str Unicode string
    datetime string str date/time
    IPAddress string str IPv4 address
    IPv6Address string str IPv6 address
    MACAddress string str MAC address
    UUID string str UUID
    enum string str enumeration value
    array array list/tuple ordered list of values
    struct object dict unordered dictionary of name/value pairs

    If allow_get_illegalvalue is true, a value None is assigned to an optional parameter, the parameter will be ignored.
Returns:

JNAP response represents as a Python object.
Exception:

Any error will cause the JnapException raised

Example:

staticRoute1 = dict(
    name = 'route1',
    settings = dict(
        interface = 'LAN',
        destinationLAN = '172.16.20.0',
        networkPrefixLength = 24,
        gateway = '192.168.1.20'
    )
)

staticRoute2 = {
    'name': 'route2',
    'settings': {
        'interface': 'LAN',
        'destinationLAN': '172.16.21.0',
        'networkPrefixLength': 24,
        'gateway': '192.168.1.21'
    }
}

objResponse = client.call(
    'SetRoutingSettings',
    isNATEnabled = True,
    isDynamicRoutingEnabled = False,
    entries = [staticRoute1, staticRoute2])
transactionReset()¶

Set the transaction queue to empty

transactionPush(action, **kwargs)¶

Push a action to the transaction queue

Parameters:
  • action (string) – Action name, refer to method call()
  • kwargs – Python Style JNAP Parameters, refer to method call()
transactionCall()¶

Call the JNAP transaction.

Example:

client.transactionReset()
client.transactionPush('GetGuestNetworkSettings')
client.transactionPush(
    'SetMACAddressCloneSettings',
    isMACAddressCloneEnabled = False)

response = client.transactionCall()
getHelp(action)¶

Return the help information for a specified JNAP action

Here is the information example:

[Overview]
  http://cisco.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeForwardingRules
  This action gets the list of port range forwarding rules
  currently set on the router.

[Prototype]
  GetPortRangeForwardingRules() => maxDescriptionLength, maxRules,
  rules
[Input Parameters]
  None
[Output Parameters]
  rules  : PortRangeForwardingRule[]
         The current list of port range forwarding rules.
  maxDescriptionLength:  int
         The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member
         of a port range forwarding rule.
  maxRules: int [optional]
         The maximum number of port range forwarding rules that
         can exist simultaneously.
[Return Values]
  OK :  Success.
  _ErrorAbortedAction: -
[Structures]
   struct PortRangeForwardingRule:
     isEnabled:  bool
         Whether the rule is enabled.
     firstExternalPort: int
         The first external port in the range that should be
         forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
     lastExternalPort: int
         The last external port in the range that should be
         forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
      protocol: ....
[Enumerates]
 ...
